frontmatter.pageTitle: Discovering Nyerere National Park: Tanzania's Hidden Wilderness Gem

pageProps.content:
Experience

Nyerere National Park, previously known as Selous Game Reserve, stands as Africa's largest standalone national park, sprawling over 30,000 square kilometers in southern Tanzania. What sets it apart is its ability to attract fewer visitors compared to its northern counterparts.
Nyerere National Park boasts pristine and untouched landscapes, offering visitors an authentic safari experience in one of Africa's last remaining wildernesses. A standout feature is the allowance for off-road driving, enabling visitors to get up close and personal with the area's resident wildlife.

Activities

One of the most sought-after activities in Nyerere National Park is extended treks through the bush, with overnight fly-camps along the way—an adventure traveler's dream come true! Permanent lodges in the area offer a range of exciting activities, including open 4x4 game drives &amp boating safaris along the Rufiji River. Guests can also indulge in guided walking safaris, bird watching, bush breakfasts, &amp romantic sundowner excursions.

When to travel

For the best wildlife viewing experience in Nyerere National Park, plan your visit between June &amp October during the dry season when animals congregate at water sources, &amp the thinner vegetation makes animal spotting easier. While the wet season, from October to May, paints the scenery lush &amp green, afternoons can become unbearably hot. Note that many lodges close their doors between March &amp May.

subfolders.title: Beho Beho Camp
subfolders.description: Set in the remote Nyerere National Park (Selous Game Reserve), Beho Beho Camp enjoys a spectacular setting on the slopes of the Namikwera Hill, overlooking the Rufiji River floodplain. Nyerere is truly one of the most magical places in Africa & covers an area of over 11,000 square miles, more than twice the size of the Serengeti!

subfolders.title: Kiba Point Selous
subfolders.description: Kiba Point, an exclusive safari retreat, is situated on the banks of the Rufiji River in Tanzania’s off-the-beaten-track Nyerere National Park. (Selous Game Reserve) Travellers looking for a remote & private safari experience will fall in love with Kiba Point which caters for families or friends in 4 stylish suites.

subfolders.title: Roho ya Selous
subfolders.description: Roho ya Selous, aptly translated as ‘Heart of the Selous’, does indeed lie at the heart of the vast Nyerere National Park (Selous Game Reserve) & boasts an idyllic hilltop location overlooking the Rufiji River. The nearby Lake Manze & Lake Nzerakera are prime wildlife areas considered to offer the best in the entire reserve.  A great mix of predators as well as elephants, buffalo herds, hippo & a variety of bird species can be seen here.

subfolders.title: Sand Rivers Selous
subfolders.description: Set on a rocky hill with breathtaking views over the Rufiji River in Nyerere National Park (Selous Game Reserve), lies an intimate safari retreat called Sand Rivers Selous. Luxurious in style, yet classic in nature – the camp is an ideal choice for travellers looking for a stylish yet authentic safari experience.

subfolders.title: Selous Serena Camp
subfolders.description: Selous Serena Camp is tucked away in a forest within the iconic Nyerere National Park (Selous Game Reserve) in Tanzania. Located on the Zema River, this boutique tented camp enjoys spectacular views & sets the scene for action-packed game viewing.

subfolders.title: Serena Mivumo River Lodge
subfolders.description: Serena Mivumo River Lodge – as the name suggests – is set on the banks of the Rufiji River in Tanzania’s game-rich Nyerere National Park. (Selous Game Reserve) Larger than Switzerland & 4 times the size of the Serengeti, Nyerere hosts one of Africa’s densest populations of lions & elephants.

subfolders.title: Siwandu Camp
subfolders.description: Siwandu Camp boasts a superb location within Africa’s largest game reserve – the Nyerere National Park, (Selous Game Reserve)  Similar in size to Switzerland & 4 times the size of the Serengeti, Nyerere promises an authentic & unparalleled wilderness experience in luxury tents.
